word:
Adjusting the Diet to Individual Needs 

                                          (1902) 7T 133, 134 
     141. In the use of foods, we should exercise good, sound common sense. When we find that a certain food does not agree with us, we need not write letters of inquiry to learn the cause of the disturbance. Change the diet; use less of some foods; try other preparations. Soon we shall know the effect that certain combinations have on us. As intelligent human beings, let us individually study the principles, and use our experience and judgment in deciding what foods are best for us. 
     [NOT ALL CAN SUBSIST ON THE SAME DIET--322]
